            TRUST FUND

abstracts.cdata!:
The project cannot be deemed as a
            success as most of its objectives were not, or only
            partially, achieved. While sustainability of the cost
            accounting system is probable as SONELEC (National Water and
            Electricity Company) has demonstrated its capability of
            using and maintaining it, sustainability of the distribution
            network is unlikely due to overall poor management.
            Specifically, the management cell for the distribution
            network, which was set up to ensure good management, was
            disbanded before the end of the project. The key lessons
            learned are: 1) need for coherent sector development plan
            prior to investment; 2) resistance to adopt procurement
            procedures that would enable smooth project implementation;
            3) need to critically assess management capacity; 4)
            phase-out of technical assistance must be carefully planned;
            5) project's objectives must be supported by targeted
            components; 6) participation of other donors needs to be
            sealed very early in the project; and 7) financial
            equilibrium is at times a more appropriate goal than rate of return.
